33340384.review:
Note : 8/10

Voilà un petit jeu bien sympathique.
Sous ses airs de jeu de plateforme se moquant allègrement des scénarios archétypiques des jeux vidéos , on trouve un univers coloré, mais qui requiert une bonne dose de réflexion afin de réunir tous les bonus.

N'hésitez pas, partez en balade avec Filo et sa petite bande de "Moi", où chacun a son caractère propre.
A chaque nouveau monde exploré, vous vous retrouverez seuls, et devrez retrouver vos autres alter egos pour parvenir au bout de niveaux fourmillant de dangers, afin de sauver le monde. (enfin c'est ce qu'à dit la grosse tête :D )

Chaque "moi" peut être personnalisé grâce à une incroyable liste d'apparences, dont certaines reprennent des personnages de jeux.

Vous pourrez également explorer le chateau du temps, où vous attendent 15 défis, tous différents.


Même si le jeu se finit assez rapidement, il vaut le coup qu'on s'y attarde un peu.
D'autant qu'il n'a pas vraiment de défauts. ;)

29494158.review: Extremely frustrating and challenging, but definitely worth it.

26359252.review: It's cute, it's fun, it looks good and it has costumes, what the hell are you waiting for ??

25464948.review: Don't let yourself be fooled by the childish art style, this game is haaaaaaard! Now, if you like a real platformer with a fair bit of challenge, you're in the right place! This combination of cuteness and hardcore platforming somehow reminds me of the first Rayman games back in the days.

25141034.review:
So Many Me is a game I'd recommend to those who enjoy puzzle games which take some time to complete but are not wanting to play a puzzle game where they end up going on Youtube for all the answers.

The graphics are astounding and have a child-like feel to them but that doesn't mean that adults and teenagers alike can't enjoy them too. 

Using your many replications you go on a quest to save the world and the girl. Going through the game Filo and his many "Me's" often make jokes about 'saving the princess', 'getting the thing on the floor because you will need it later' and many other similar jokes. The concept of having many replications of yourself and completing puzzles with them definitely made the game more interesting to play.

There are 3 unique forms of travel in So Many Me (apart from on foot) which are by Jellophant (Tank), Jellosaur (Dinosaur), Balloonbird (Bird). The forms of travel allow you to travel on spikes and destroy EVERYTHING, destroy vertical walls and jump higher and fly and destroy horizontal walls respectively. 

Obviously you have a Story which you can play and complete. Within this story are many costumes and coins which you can get through extra effort to eventually fully complete the game.

Like many other reviews, the only important downside is the Bosses. The bosses themselves are not too hard but there are hardly any checkpoints in these battles so you have to memorise the landscape and the movements of the boss. 

Personally I had trouble with one section of the game.
[spoiler] After the Final Boss (The guy you meet at the beginning) there is an escape part of the level. The path of this section isn't too difficult but the meteors sometimes hit you at the ONLY moments where you either dodge and fall off the map or jump off the platforms into spikes. The best part of all this is that there are NO checkpoints. [/spoiler]

If anybody wants to know, I got all achievements in 10 hours and 36 minutes which involves the main story, extra missions (Chrono Castle) and all collectables.

I know it says 11 hours on my profile. That's because I left the game on while writing this review :D

23022376.review:
[h1] "ถ้ากำลังมองหาเกมพัซเซิลซักเกมไว้คลายเครียดก็ข้ามเกมนี้ไปซะ เพราะเกมนี้ยิ่งเล่น ยิ่งเครียด"
 [/h1]

อีกหนึ่งเกมดีฝีมือคนไทยจาก Extend Studio (ผู้พัฒนาเกม A.R.E.S. ที่ได้วางขายบนสตีมในปี 2011) ในคราวนี้ ... เกมมาในรูปแบบ Puzzle น่ารักๆแต่แฝงไปด้วยความโหดเหี้ยม(ของปริศนา) โดยผู้เล่นจะได้รับบทเป็น "Filo" โพริ่งน้อยตัวสีเขียวสดใสมันวาว(ออกจะคล้ายสลามซะมากกว่าอ่ะนะ) ที่บังเอิญได้รับพลังวิเศษบางอย่างมา ซึ่งแน่นอนว่า ... พลังที่ยิ่งใหญ่ก็มักจะมาพร้อมกับความรับผิดชอบอันยิ่งใหญ่เช่นกัน งานนี้เค้าจึงต้องรับบทเป็นผู้กอบกู้โลกตามคำบอกเล่าของ "Asimov" ไปโดยปริยาย

เกมนี้ ภาษาไม่ต้องแข็งก็เล่นได้ (ก็เกมแนว Puzzle อ่ะนะ) ไม่มีปรับระดับยากง่าย เค้าให้ปริศนามายังไง ก็ต้องแก้ตามนั้น ในตัวเกมมีมุขคอยสอดแทรกตลอดเวลา เพลงที่แสนไพเราะ และภาพที่ถูกออกแบบมาได้สวยงาม สดใสๆ เหมาะกับเด็กทุกเพศทุกวัย ... ยกเว้นเรื่องปริศนา เพราะปริศนาในเกมนี้บางด่านก็ยากเอาเรื่องเลย

ส่วนตัวให้ 9 จาก 10 ล่ะกัน หักคะแนนตรงที่ตัวเกมไม่สามารถตั้งค่าปุ่มได้ เค้าให้มายังไง ต้องเอาตามนั้นเลย ถามว่าควรซื้อมั้ย พิจารณาคำเตือนด้านล่างเอาล่ะกัน แต่ไม่อยากให้มองว่าเพราะเป็น "เกมไทย" เลยซื้อนะ อยากให้มองว่ามันเป็นเกมที่ดีเกมนึงมากกว่า ...

*** คำเตือน ***
1. ใครคิดว่าเกมแนว Puzzle ไม่ใช่แนวของตัวเอง ก็ผ่านไปเลย เพราะหัวใจของเกมนี้คือ Puzzle ล้วนๆ (แต่ซื้อไว้สนับสนุนผู้พัฒนาก็ดีนะ)
2. อาจมีงงกับปุ่มบังคับเล่นเพราะเกมนี้ "ปรับปุ่มคอนโทรลไม่ได้" เค้าจัดอันไหนมา ต้องใช้อันนั้น เรื่องนี้ต้องรับไหวนะ ...
3. บางด่านก็ยากโคตรๆ ตัวเกมเหมือนเกมแนว Puzzle น่ารักๆ พอมาเล่นก็คนละเรื่องเลย แต่ก็ถือว่า "ท้าทาย" ดี
4. ไม่เหมาะกับคน "หัวร้อน" ง่าย ... เพราะขอบอกไว้ก่อนเลยว่า เกมนี้ "ตายง่าย" และ "ตายบ่อย" เอามากๆ วันดีคืนดีตีย์บอร์ดอาจจะพังก็ได้
5. ไม่แนะนำให้ดูเฉลยตามเว็บหรือคลิปต่างๆ ให้พยายามทำให้เต็มที่ก่อน พยายามก่อน ... ถ้าไม่ได้จริงๆก็ค่อยเปิด แต่ผมเล่นมาขนาดนี้ก็ยังไม่ได้เปิดดูซักอันเลยนะ ...
6. ใครไม่ "Happy" กับราคาเต็มก็รอราคาลดก็ได้ อันนี้ไม่ว่ากัน ...

22462779.review:
So many me est un jeu extrêmement mignon qui n'est pas en reste au niveau du contenu et des mécaniques de jeu. J'ai adoré y passer du temps et il vaut largement les 15€ demandés pour l'acquérir si vous visez les 100%. Bourré de bonnes idées, de nombreuses références à d'autres jeux mais également d'humour, ne croyez pas qu'il ne vous tiendra pas en haleine, certaines énigmes étant tout de même assez complexes. Cela dit il le fera uniquement si vous souhaitez trouver tous les objets cachés, autrement finir le jeu en ligne droite s'avère un peu trop simple.

Test complet : http://aquab0n.fr/2014/09/test-so-many-me.html

22044295.review: The demo is very misleading, this game is actually extremely hard and frustrating. The lack of checkpoints (Especially during later levels, like Chrono Clock) makes me want to pull my hair out and cry in the corner.

20862442.review: a unique game. much fun to pass the time, as well as provide a pleasent challenge.

20134116.review:
People seem to like itemised lists so here we go.

WHAT I LOVED
-Challenging puzzles. So Many Me really pushed and probed my brain in unexpected ways. The deceptively simple mechanics can be used in devious ways thanks to a clever rule: You use your petrified clones as stepping stones or switch-stoppers, but instead of allowing you to reclaim your clones in the more expected first-in/first out fashion, it has to be done in a last-in/first out one. This means that the most intuitive "order" of actions is incorrect and you have to learn to think in a different way. This also has the effect of constantly keeping you barely ahed of resource-starvation as you have to leave most of your available copies behind to allow you to retrace your steps when you find the key item or power-up that a certain obstacle requires.
-Colourful and sharp graphics. The game is really easy on the eyes, especially if you like cutesy Nintendo-like characters and settings.
-The soundtack is nice and evocative, if nothing super memorable. It helps you keep relaxed in the moments where you want to tear your hair off. How could a puzzle game provoke such reaction, you ask? Keep reading.
-Achievements. Very few of the patronising "you did something that you needed to do anyway!" types and a lot of ones that encouraged you to go out of your way to do more things or do them in a different way.

WHAT I DIDN'T LOVE, DIDN'T HATE/SOMETIMES LOVED, SOMETIMES HATED
-Platforming. The overall mechanics of the game and the kind of obstacles and power-ups provide an opportunity for interesting and challenging platforming... however your character's movement is not as polished and pixel-perfect as it should be. This results in what seem like punishing and unfair deaths at some points which are especially frustrating when they come as part of a puzzle that requires a lenghty and complex setup on your end. The game includes a bonus challenge area where most of the puzzle elements are stripped out and it explores and pushes the possibilities of the platforming mechanics. It emphasises both the enormous potential of the world they built and the infuriating roughness of the controls.
-Humour. It was pretty hit and miss. It made me smile about as many times as it made me roll my eyes.
-Collectibles and game lenght. Too many of the former and a bit to little of the latter, which makes the former more obvious. There is a high number of seemingly random cosmetic collectibles plus a significant number of near useless upgrades and power-ups. Is all very harmless but it's hard not to think that they were created as filler content to fluff up a somewhat short and simple game.  

WHAT I HATED
-The story. I'll be blunt here: it was so bad that I wish it didn't have any story at all. Completely strewn with the most tired cliches and tropes which were made not any better by the characters continuously lampshading how very trite it all was. The fact that it was less-than-expertly translated to English doesn't help.
-The last boss battle included one element of randomness that made an already long, difficult and repetitive sequence of actions all the more frustrating.


All things said, the things I loved far outstrip the few glaring flaws, so I gladly recommend this game to anyone looking for a good brain exerciser.

20073842.review: Puzzle/Plataforma mais fofo que jah vi na minha vida...

19748897.review:
Это прекрастная игра! Первы раз, когда я её увидел, мне очень понравился этот умильный и яркий стиль. Я сразу добавил игрушку в желаемое. Когда купил, я понял что у игры еще и офигенный и необычный геймплей, с кучей особенностей + отличные персонажи и хорошая музыка. 

Но к сожалению эту игру постигла участь многих похожих проектов - сложность. Может быть я просто не умею играть в подобные игры и мне нужно что-то более казуальное, но после 30% прохождения игра началася логический ад. Головоломки логичные, но очень сложные. Наверное нужно больше погрузится в геймплейные детали, чтобы постичь дзен данной игрушки, но у меня не вышло. Думаю, что еще вернусь в мир Som Many Me и исправлю данную ошибку.

Очень рекомендую, но не ведитесь на детский дизайн игры, она сложная!

19683669.review:
A really like the demo and bought the game a while ago, I left it there as I think it leverages too much on extremely precision platforming and puzzles that can end up being frustating because of the above reason. I like the challenge but nearly every single part of the game is precision platforming (when I say precision I really mean it, nearly at the "pixel" level or you just die and repeat). 

It is a shame as the graphic and characters are brilliant and I would have surely enjoyed it if it was a super mario style game more than a serie of frustating levels.

18833192.review: Fun puzzle platformer where you earn clones of yourself as you go on and can use them to solve various puzzles by turning them into stepping stones or combining with them, etc.

18774287.review:
Disclaimer: I receive this game for free from the developer for writing a review in Thai here: https://www.blognone.com/node/58449

So Many Me is a puzzle game where you have to control your characters from start point to finnish point. The very first stage are easy, but then the difficulty spike real fast. So you can expect a lot of WTF moments when trying to 100% complete the game.

I still think this game is worth playing. It's not close to perfect, not even in my favorite puzzle games list. But looking back after years of lots of game playing, I find out that puzzle game is hard to made. And this game-- though I think it's not very good --still beats the average out of puzzle games in the market. So if you're into puzzle game, then gives it a try, you might be disappoint in some aspects, but overall you'll find it not hard to forgive and like it.

18240546.review: "Dark Forest" is fun. The difficulty ramps up too high in "Outskirts" to make the game enjoyable. There is only so much screaming at my monitor that I can take.

17554617.review: Don't trust So Many Me's cute exterior, because behind the mask of dozens of cute costumes and a silly story hides a feindish puzzle game. This games puzzles take time to unravel and all the while gives you cheery music and cute graphics to look at. I'd wholey recommend this game to anyone who loves puzzle platformers.

17169013.review:
똑같이 생긴 '나'들을 적절히 활용해가며 스테이지를 풀어 나가는 퍼즐 플래포머 게임.

주인공인 Filo와 Filo를 닮은 '나'들이 굉장히 귀엽다. 거기다 다양한 방법으로 획득할 수 있는 코스츔을 적용시키면 그 귀여움이 배로 증가한다. 탈것도 세 가지나 등장하는데, 이 탈것들도 Filo와 '나'들 못지 않은 귀여움을 자랑한다. 심지어 적으로 등장하는 몬스터들도 깜찍하다. 다른 건 몰라도 '귀여움' 점수만큼은 10점 만점에 10점이다.

Filo와 '나'는 생긴것도 똑같고 특성도 똑같다. 따라서 이 캐릭터들을 활용해가며 앞으로 나아가는 것이 중요하다. 예를 들자면, 한 명의 '나'가 발판이 되고, 다른 '나'들이 발판이 된 '나'를 활용해 더 위로(혹은 앞으로) 나아갈 수 있는 것이다. (물론, 발판이 된 '나'를 다시 불러올 수도 있다.) 이후에는 '나'의 특성을 바꿔주는 열매도 등장하고 다른 기능을 갖고 있는 '탈것'도 등장하며, 이것들을 적극적으로 활용해야 하는 스테이지들이 나온다. 손보다는 머리가 더 아플 만한 게임. 

스테이지를 진행하면서 적당한 지점에 다다르면 자동 세이브가 수시로 된다. 덕분에 실패를 크게 두려워하지 않아도 된다. 헌데 막상 보스전만큼은 이 자동 세이브가 상당히 부실해서 한 번 죽으면 처음부터 보스전을 다시 치뤄야 하는 경우가 많이 생긴다. 특히 마지막 보스는 상당히 어려운 편인데, 어째서 여기에만 유독 세이브 지역이 인색한건지에 대해선 조금 납득하기 어렵다.

그 밖에 추가 스테이지인 시공의 성이 존재한다. 총 15개의 스테이지가 존재하며 각 스테이지마다 컨셉이 굉장히 다양하다. 고도화된 컨트롤을 요구하는 스테이지부터 단순한 미니게임 형식의 스테이지까지 온갖 컨셉의 스테이지가 준비되어 있다. 단순히 컨트롤을 요구하는 스테이지들로만 채운 것이 아니라, 다양한 컨셉의 스테이지를 준비해뒀다는 점이 이색적이다.

아쉬운 점이라면 다시 플레이하기가 조금 까다롭달까. 스테이지마다 새로운 '나'를 얻어야 하는 스테이지들이 있어서 그런지 각 챕터의 스테이지를 따로 골라 플레이할 수가 없다. 따라서 도중에 못 먹은 아이템 같은게 있다면 아예 그 챕터를 처음부터 다시 플레이해야 한다. 게임의 특성 상 어쩔 수 없긴 하지만, 여전히 아쉽게 느껴질 만한 부분이다.

조종할 캐릭터가 점점 많아지니 플레이 하면 할 수록 머리에 쥐는 좀 나겠지만, 여러명의 '나'라는 컨셉이 신선하고 또 그만큼 상당히 재미있는 플래포머 게임이다. 머리 쓰는 플래포머를 선호하는 이들에게 추천하고픈 게임.

http://blog.naver.com/kitpage/220429414420

17107623.review: absolutely love this game. i love the characters, everything is so cute and its relaxing to play. really enjoyable :)

16352029.review:
[h1]Красочный, хардкорный платформер[/h1]

Красочный, на вид безобидный пазл-платформер, который заставит помучиться каждого любителя данного жанра.
Хотите посидеть и порешать головоломки, тогда сыграйте в So Many Me. Любите попрыгать по платформам, тогда вам тоже сюда.
Игра чем-то напоминает Braid, но в ней нет возможности управлять временем. Зато вы можете создавать множество платформ, разных видов, для того чтобы решить головоломки и пройти уровень.
Если сюжетные уровни вам показались легкими, попробуйте пройти "Chrono Castle" - достаточно сложные уровни. Каждый уровень имеет свою особенность. Например в одном вам нужно очень точно прыгать. В другом очень быстро иначе умрете. А в третьем уровне нужно не торопиться и хорошо подумать, чтобы его пройти.
Лично мне как любителю сложных головоломок и платформеров эта игра очень понравилась.
Советую и вам приобрести ее.
-----------------------------------------------
Моя оценка 10/10.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

[h1]Colorful, hardcore platformer [/h1]

Colorful, seemingly innocuous puzzle platformer that will make suffer every lover of the genre.
You want to sit and puzzle poreshat then play in So Many Me. I love to jump on the platforms, then you, too, here.
The game is somewhat reminiscent of Braid, but it is not possible to manage time. But you can create a variety of platforms, different kinds, in order to solve the puzzle and complete the level.
If you plot the levels seem easy, try to go through "Chrono Castle" - quite difficult levels. Each level has its own peculiarity. For example, in one you have to jump very accurately. In another very quickly or else die. And in the third level, you need to take your time and think well, to pass it.
Personally, I like amateur challenging puzzles and platformer this game very much.
And I advise you to buy it.
-----------------------------------------------
My rating 10/10.

Alcuni rompicapo per prendere vestiti, coins o altri filo sono molto complessi, altri, invece ben fattibili e facile.
Man mano che andiamo avanti il gioco diventa più complicato, ma noi avremo anche altru poteri dati da frutti particolari, non solo ma anche da varie combinazioni date dai vari "me"
Consigliato

遊戲本身要破關不難

12973876.review:
Giusto per citare di nuovo Offspring Fling!, con il quale So Many Me condivide una grafica e atmosfere coloratissime, se il gioco di Kyle Pulver è il prodotto di velocità e precisione, il secondo ne è la perfetta antitesi. L’avventura di Filo avrà tempistiche e risoluzioni estremamente lente, con un gameplay focalizzato maggiormente sullo studio dell’intero quadro per trovare e liberare i tre bonus presenti e raggiungere la fine incolumi. A dire il vero, completare i livelli non è quasi mai difficile, ma sbloccare gli oggetti vi farà sudare sette camice. Questi si dividono in nuovi Me (neanche a dirlo, vitali per andare avanti), in costumi alternativi con i quali personalizzare i Me, in monete e in artefatti (che si forgiano con le monete e offrono bonus più o meno utili). La struttura dei livelli è sempre abbastanza complessa: pur essendo tendenzialmente libera e poco lineare, spesso capiterà di trovare una divisione per zone dove affrontare avversità e nemici per sbloccare il relativo bonus. Il ragionamento è alla base di tutto So Many Me: coadiuvato da un trial & error incredibilmente permissivo, anche grazie a checkpoint automatici quasi per ogni salto compiuto (rendendo quindi minimo il fastidio di un errore), passeremo la maggior parte del tempo a studiare i collegamenti tra gli elementi dello scenario per risalire alla soluzione possibile.

Contro di noi ci saranno tutta una schiera di torrette a ricerca, mostriciattoli salterini, nemici armati e chi più ne ha, più ne metta. Ciò che conta è la loro ottima varietà, divisa saggiamente per tutte le zone del mondo di So Many Me, anch’essi unici e dal sistema di gioco peculiare. Per aiutarci in tale sfida, oltre ai nostri compagni che — una volta liberati — potranno svolgere la funzione di appiglio ovunque desidereremo posizionarli (sempre a patto che si tratti di una zona libera da effetti avversi), avremo a disposizione dei semi in grado di donare a Filo e ai tanti Me delle abilità particolari. Il seme rosso, per esempio, renderà il nostro Me un trampolino a rimbalzo, permettendoci di raggiungere zone inaccessibili, quello blu trasformerà il Me in un pugno-mongolfiera, che trascinerà verso l’alto i Me attaccati, mentre quello giallo attirerà l’attenzione di nemici potenzialmente letali per il nostro gruppo di eroi e così via. Soluzioni di gameplay interessanti che vengono sfruttate ampiamente all’interno dei quadri, sempre molto ben congegnati, e che permettono saltuariamente di trovare soluzioni diverse su come risolvere gli scenari.

Vieni a leggere la recensione completa su TheShelterNetwork.com:
http://theshelternetwork.com/so-many-me/

12680702.review:
买了好久决定还是写一篇小小的评测！
好玩！好玩到飞起！又萌又好玩，总而言之就是一个以搜集为主的，想要过关很简单，就是搜集起来要动点脑筋，但是也不至于为难我们这些智商不足操作捉急的人，关卡新颖的，剧情么中规中矩里透着萌（最后打败了大魔王救出了那个傻大姐 ）。以及在我打开了Chrono Castle之后觉得简直就是新世界，前面的剧情流程都是在为了给Chrono Castle的关卡做铺垫……至今在chrono castle还有几关没有搜集全，心里也是塞塞的……但是的确是佳作！是个特别适合我们这种没什么耐心玩大作的温馨治愈小萌萌TUT。

12404595.review:
Puzzle platformer where platforming ends up being part of the puzzles thanks to the abilities you gain. At the most basic, you get a queue of critters to run around with, with the ability to turn them into fresh platforms and other helpful things to hlep you get through the stages.

Ridiculously cute, geniunely funny and surprisingly tough without getting unfair. Haven't gotten that far yet, but it does keep introducing new mechanics at decent pace, and then mixes and matches them with the ones already established in interesting ways.

11863093.review:
Lets get the positive things about this game over and done with first. It's music is brilliant and the art has a cutesey charm to it that's...well, charming. Beyond that though? There is little to praise about the game.

The games premise - at least from the trailer - would be that the game would at least try to put you in the mindset of questioning who you are in society, how different you are to everyone else who seems to similar, and perhaps this was me reading too far into the trailer (but starting it with "Have you ever asked yourself the ultimate question in life?" I assumed it was asking philosophy, not comedy), and while the 'clones' are present in the game, they pose little actual use beyond placable objects. You're given the ability to alter their properties when they're placed (to turn them into a balloon that floats, or a red splotch that you can bounce on), but the order you give the clones their property is the order you have to place them in - no switching what clone you're using, or seperating a modified clone with a default one - this adds a little to the 'puzzle' elements though I guess, but it just feels rather than using many 'you' (or many Me), you've only got one.

Originally I played with keyboard and mouse (not the best idea), which uses the directional arrows rather than 'conventional' WASD, where the 'D' key has been mapped as a button to recall your last clone, and with no option to rebind the keys, I was kind of let down. I switched to a 360 controller and most of these troubles went away! Having the option to rebind the keys in game would be a bonus though, but I'm not sure how easy that is to do on Unity.

I felt the controls were quite sloppy at first (both with k&m and controller), and the controls certainly aren't too refined, so it took some getting used to - perhaps this is because they look more like balls of goop than something solid, but occasionally things happened that I wasn't expecting with the character.

The 'puzzles' are what you would expect from a platformer - find a way to get to a place to pull a switch that lets you do something else to get to the end - most of the puzzling involved is remembering what teleporter leads to what other teleporter, or pulling switches to see what it does. While it may sound as if I'm condemning it to 'give it to your child' I'm not. The puzzles combined with the enemies make this game somewhat challenging (most of this seems to be artificial challenge, given a lot of the puzzles can be skipped with skills you discover within the first level or so). Which now brings me onto one little element in the game. For 90% of the levels, you're able to move the camera around the level - as most puzzle games allow, so you can think things through, see what's up ahead, don't make silly mistakes (etc.), but for the last / boss level on every stage, this is removed, and for me this felt [i]very[/i] restricting, and I can't really see why this was done, especially for one particular area - for the most part, jumping down holes at the bottom of the map results in death, for this one it resulted in moving onto the next area. It is a little thing, I know, but you set up a presidence (don't jump down holes unless you know you can survive it) and then you break it? Not brilliant game design, really.

The enemies - for most part, are okay. Nothing special to talk about really - fair deal for platformer games; jump on their head (multiple times for some enemies) and they die, touch anywhere else and you die. There are certain enemies later on in the game that are able to kill you (virtually) instantly, if you're close enough and in a line of sight (even if they aren't 'looking' at you - which makes me wonder why they even appear to have a 'cone of sight'). While this means you have to deal with them in alternate ways than other enemies, given that you getting killed pulls you back to the last time you touched the ground, this can be annoying, as it reverts the clones to whatever they had been modified with beforehand, but recalls any clones you had already placed back, so for puzzles with longer setups, this can be annoying.
And now this leads us into the bosses.
When one of the features of the game is being panned by basically every review, you know something isn't right.
While the bosses do share some story time (not all of them - the last one was a bird who got annoyed that it got woken up), most are rather irellevant and only seem to be there as other games have bosses. I would have recommended this game, despite the bosses, if it hadn't been for one particular boss - the lava boss. A lot of the time it seems you're making leaps of faith across gaps, hoping that you don't get hit by a rock, and doing that over and over - if you DO get hit, any work you have done to kill the boss is removed.

Summing this game up in a sentence:
It looks good, and sounds great, but beyond that it's not that much different to platformers already on the market.

11831007.review:
This is a great game, the art style, the cuteness, the story and even the puns.
It deffinatly isn't for the faint hearted it requires alot of patiance and thinking outside the box. It will drive you nuts at times trying to solve the puzzles and the bosses. 
There isn't really much Killing its more so trying to work around the enemies and the enviroment but in saying that it doesnt mean there is no killing at all. 
You can customize your many me's with cute different outfits, and you also get the opportunity to be a Bird, a Jellysaur (yes thats right i said a Jellysaur!) and even a tank!
If this was intended for children well i feel sorry for them, I can already picture many controllers being thrown across the room or even a desk flip. 
Worth every cent!

It's been a long time since I've been so captivated by a game that I played for hours without realizing it.

11564339.review:
緑のゼリー「フィロ」が主人公のパズル・プラットフォーマー
世界を救うため、自身のクローンを増やしながら冒険していきます。

このゲームの主要な要素として、クローンを使ったパズルが挙げられます。
クローンを石化させて足場や重りとして使い、道を切り開いていくのですがクローンの数に制限がありますので
どこで石化させるのか・どの様な順番で石化させるのか（クローンは最後に石化したものから元に戻せる）といったことを考えさせられます。

後半になるにつれ、パズルが複雑になっていきます。ですが収集要素がいらないのであれば、ステージのクリア自体は比較的簡単ですのでゲームの進行が完全に止まることはないでしょう。

幻想的な世界観やとても愛らしいキャラクター、フィロ達のコスチューム収集要素等が私達を飽きさせることなくゲームに没頭させてくれることでしょう。

物語の進行とは別に、何か物足りないハードコアゲーマーのためにちょっとしたご褒美（試練）も用意されていますのでご安心ください。

So Many Me, yes, as it seems, it is 2D puzzled platformer game, like Mario but with some more features and puzzles, of course! From the first of gameplay, you [strike]including me[/strike] will think this game is just sold for kids who just love soooo cuteee <3 arts. Yes, sure, it's cute and  graphics are super goooood... It is not burning your eyes like some 2.5 or 3D games. It will be good and relaxing in your eyes. What makes this game fun? Just when you played about half hour, you will forget game's cuteness like others said. Because puzzles are surprisingly harder than you expect, it requires quite some thinking to get past. I mean, to get all items, of course. Because going to the end of each map is too easy, and doesn't even require brains. Although storyline and boss battles are not really good, much. But overall, game is good to try. Try it, and you will know it worths.

11289914.review:
Given the charming, cutesy art and some emphasis on riding creatures, my initial thoughts were that [i]So Many Me[/i] would be akin to Nintendo’s favorite kid-friendly pink puffball, Kirby, with some added puzzle elements to round out the package. And in some ways, I was right. The aforementioned art design is adorable and inviting, and riding the animals, (especially the dino), brought back fond memories of riding Rick the Hamster or Coo the Owl from Kirby’s Dreamland. But this is where the similarities to Nintendo’s friendliest series end, and for the better, in many respects. [i]So Many Me[/i]’s emphasis on expansive, challenging puzzles and platforming prowess provides an exceptionally demanding cerebral and dexterous experience that I never expected. And I absolutely adored every moment of it.

From the moment you boot up the game, you’re assaulted by one of the cutest and charming art styles this side of [i]Kirby’s Epic Yarn[/i], and from the get-go, the bubbly movement of the characters and the world they inhabit put a big smile on my face. But as adorable as they are, the graphics disguise the true nature of [i]So Many Me[/i]. It’s [i]extremely[/i] challenging. It’s easy to reach the end of each level, sure, but by [i]only[/i] doing so, you’re missing out on more than half of what the game has to offer. Of the main worlds, (of which there are four, each with their own specific gimmicks) reaching the end, as I said, is easy to do. Rather than simple exercises in moving rightwards whilst jumping over small pits, levels range from small to expansive networks filled with traps and tricks for you decipher your way around. Most are avoidable, unless you aim to collect the three collectibles in each stage. Each level hides a costume, an extra Me, and an artifact. And these aren’t hidden in the traditional sense; you’ll be able to see them, plain as day, as well as the seemingly impossible-to-bypass trickery blocking your path to each. This is where the [i]true[/i] game lies. The puzzles between you and those delectable collectibles range from the small and simple to the overly complex and level-wide. Even once you’ve figured out [i]what[/i] you’re supposed to do, it’s an entirely different matter pulling it all off without screwing up. 

And you will mess up. A big part of what makes these often complex puzzle layouts complex , is that in congruence with an often demanding level of dexterity on your part, you will have to carefully manage the use of your me’s which provide you with stepping stones, switch presses, bounce pads and other varying abilities dependent on world. Mess up the proper order of tasks even once, and it’s back to step one. It’s as much about strategy as it is making each clean jump. I often found myself stuck on figuring out several of the more complex puzzles in the game for nearly a half hour or more, since there are often so many pieces you can experiment with, but it made the satisfaction of [i]finally[/i] getting that artifact or costume so much sweeter. But most importantly, the collectibles [i]matter[/i]. Besides the obvious use of having extra mes or new costumes (which you can use to uniquely dress up each and every me), artifacts are used to purchase perks, which range from the purely aesthetic to the all-but-necessary in reaching certain collectibles. There are no superfluous “good job!” collectibles here, and when the game [i]really[/i] makes you earn each and every one, it truly feels like an achievement.

Luckily, checkpoints are forgiving, and so long as you remain in the level, enemies do not respawn outside of specific instances, even after you fall into a spike pit a half dozen times. And thankfully, you’re never asked to find every collectible in a single go; you’re free to try again at any time, as each level is easily selected from the game’s pause menu. Allow me to iterate: Once you find a me in a given level, or a costume, or an artifact, it’s yours. Once you kill an enemy, outside of specific instances, that enemy remains gone, as long as you remain in the level. This all leads to levels feeling more like contained little worlds, rather than [i]just[/i] levels, each with their own sense of progression, especially in some specific instances, where smaller puzzles act as cogs leading into a whole. Further variation in mechanics come in the form of your creatures, which you’ll utilize plenty, and the boss battles ending each world. These are generally of no real concern once you have their given patterns down, and it’s only until the final boss that you might have any real trouble, as the difficulty is dramatically increased here from what you’ve faced previously. But again, it’s all a matter of pattern memorization and careful movement.

For anyone more inclined toward the purely platformer aspect of [i]So Many Me[/i], in addition to the four main worlds and end boss levels, the developers have kindly opted to include a fifth bonus world, filled almost entirely with exceptionally challenging platformance gauntlets. Many of these courses demand perfection on the part of the player to succeed, even more so than some of the later levels in the standard worlds, and each offers two elusive artifacts just out of reach for all but the most skilled platformer aficionados. With no checkpoints to speak of, a few skirt the line of frustration that lies between the game’s mechanics and your own inability to succeed, though it typically lies closer to the latter. I cannot stress how challenging some these completely optional segments are, and along with the larger puzzles provide some of the most satisfying moments in the game to best, especially with both artifact pieces in tow.

[i]So Many Me[/i] is brilliant. If it wasn’t clear in the preceding paragraphs, know now that I adored the entire experience. Despite looking more kid friendly in nature, [i]So Many Me[/i] offers a fantastic challenge for puzzle and platformer fanatics alike, with some extremely intricate puzzles requiring serious forethought as well as dexterity and finesse. And to that end, allow me to make clear one final time: more than half the game lies in collecting the various trinkets. Failure to even attempt would be denying yourself the immense joy in besting the devious designs keeping them from you, and would keep you from experiencing the best of what this game has to offer, since reaching the end itself contains comparably little challenge on its own. Try and best each level, trinkets and all, and I guarantee that you will love the adventure as much as I. It took me 10 hours to complete everything, and that included plenty of screen-staring just trying to figure out many of the given puzzles. A keener mind than mine will finish it much more quickly. [i]Me[/i] offers an adorable world, filled with beautiful scenery and character design, a silly and very self-aware sense of humor, plenty of seekables, and puzzles and platforming designed for a matured gamer wanting an actual challenge in their cutesy puzzle-platformer. That challenge is delivered in spades, and you’ll be grinning ear to ear, in between bouts of cursing at your own ineptitude.

 [b]If you have a question about [i]So Many Me[/i] or this review, leave a comment and I will answer to the best of my ability.[/b]

11289796.review:
Il ne paye pas de mine, mais So Many Me est un sacré jeu de réflexion ! Mignon comme tout, le bébé de Extend Studio nous surprend par sa difficulté diabolique, avec son concept d'utilisation de clones pour progresser. Bien sûr, il est possible de le traverser sans trop de mal mais ce serait passer à côté du réel intérêt du soft : le 100% ! Quelques soucis sont à noter, comme le côté chaotique des niveaux les plus ardus et l'inutilité des boss, mais ne boudons pas notre plaisir : So Many Me est une réussite !

like seriously you can freaking get a fez and be "Doctor" Filo if you want
The game is truly enjoyable and one of the best games I have ever played pretty much ever.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=43tbUppr0sg I highly recommend this game to anyone who loves puzzle platform games and also has a liking for comedy because this game has a fair amount of it.

11278615.review:
So Many Me is a breath of fresh air in a genre that is plagued with mediocre at best games. The gams is  first off is a very visually stunning game, I can't help but feel like I lost 50 points to my manliness scale when I play it because the artstyle makes me gigle like a schoolgirl. What I didn't expect on top of the great visuals is a great puzzle platformer as well. The mechanics are very solid and challenging, the idea of utilzing multiple replicas of yourself in unique ways to complete levels or get that epic hat that you've been wanting makes the actual gameplay experience very rewarding. The replayability is there as well, there are loads of unlocks that give you cosmetic items throughout the map. Obtaining these will allow you to customize ALL of your replicas. I HIGHLY recommend So Many Me for any fan of puzzle platformers or just simpily cutesy games.

If you prefer video format of basically what I said up there I do that too!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RnwwbRi1DL0&list=UUf2ocK7dG_WFUgtDtrKR4rw

11251984.review: Great visuals and gameplay. There are hats and boss battles too, lots of stuff to unlock and explore basicly. The puzzles can be challenging sometimes and this is a good thing.

11236780.review:
So Many Me is a fun and simple puzzle platformer. It's easy to pickup and play with it's simple control scheme. The idea of the game is that you are saving a world where you run into yourself many, many times. You can use yourself in your adventures to turn into blocks and solve puzzles. It's a fun and interesting concept, but doesn't bring anything excitingly new to the table. If you have a soft spot for platformers, this one will fit well into your library.

Here is my commentated video with more of my thoughts along with gameplay footage.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oHNP7PijIm8

11218011.review: Beautiful little title, definitely worth a purchase!

10524973.review: Hi! Our team developed this game so I'm a little biased. I strongly recommend "So Many Me" to everyone who looks forward to challenging puzzle-platformer.
